title: Russian Constructivist Type
content:
I am looking for fonts that have a Russian Constructivist look and feel to them. Something that would perhaps have cyrillic alphabet characters, but it would also need to be well adapted to english. I am creating a CD packaging project of Russian composers. Here are some sketches of what I am sort of thinking about but am at a lack to find a good font to use.   
 ![Picture of Type usage idea #1](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123249im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20321.jpg)   
 ![Type idea #2](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123249im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20322.gif)   
Thanks for your help.
author: potentate_doug

comments.content:
Try these previous forum threads for starters:   
   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19496.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123249/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19496.html)   
   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/3090.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123249/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/3090.html)

A couple of recent designs with both Cyrillic and Latin characters, shown in the _Language Culture Type_ book from ATypI/Graphis:   
   
Rouble by Andrey Belonogov   
   
Serp'n'Molot by Tagir Safayev (based on letterforms designed by Sergey Chekhonin in the early 20th century: not strictly Constructivist, but very wonderful).   
   
I'm not sure where you could get either, but the good people at [www.paratype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123249/http:/www.paratype.com/) should be able to help you.
